channel.title: Help!

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

Your computer doesn’t know how to run the javaw because it is not in the pc’s CLASSPATH. There are 2 ways to fix it:

  1. Set your classpath (I forget how, to be honest) so that your computer knows where to run the javaw executable.

  2. Instead of having just “javaw” in the run.bat file, navigate to where Java is installed on your machine and find the “javaw.exe” file yourself (probably in the “bin” folder). Copy this entire file path (including the “javaw.exe” part) and paste it where javaw used to be (with quotes at the start and end of the file path).

It should then work. Most run.bat files that I have encountered have taken the more reliable route and have used option 2 above but it all depends on your preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @brandonormerod brandonormerod
item.description:
@brandonormerod wrote:

hello
i have a problem, when ever i download a server it says…windows can not find ‘javaw’.make sure you typed the name correctly, then try again… happens every time … so i right click run and click edit and this pops up…

@echo off
start javaw -Xmx500m-cp.;Theme.jar Gui
exit

should i change anything or add anything ?

Read full topic
